name: Dana Naser
profile: Motivated 3rd-year B.Sc. Information Systems student (GPA 82). Strong background in Java, SQL, and OOP, with hands-on experience in ETL pipelines, Linux, and cloud-native concepts. Familiar with Docker & Kubernetes; exploring real-time stream processing. Quick learner, fluent in English, and eager to contribute to Agile, international teams at SAP.

relevant_coursework.name: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming
Mathematics for Logic and Discrete Structures

projects.name: Hospital Management System
highlights: Desktop application for managing hospital operations and patient records
Applied OOP principles and persistent data storage techniques
Emphasized modular structure and structured decision-support logic
Focused on system reliability and performance optimization

projects.name: Wine Inventory Management System
highlights: Full-stack desktop system with XML/JSON import/export and database integration
ETL-style data processing with executable JAR delivery and usability focus
Applied Agile teamwork practices with emphasis on stable, reliable data management
